meta.name: The Shire Passport
meta.description: Official Documentation of One's Journey Through Middle-earth

badges.name: Breakfast
badges.shortDesc: The first meal of the day
badges.longDesc: The most important meal in the Shire. One cannot simply begin a quest on an empty stomach.
badges.instruction: Eat breakfast to claim this badge.

badges.name: Second Breakfast
badges.longDesc: What about second breakfast? A true hobbit never forgets. Pippin would be proud.
badges.instruction: Eat second breakfast to claim this badge.

badges.name: "I Will Take It"
badges.longDesc: In the House of Elrond, a small voice changes the fate of Middle-earth. "I will take the Ring to Mordor. Though... I do not know the way."
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: Elevenses
badges.longDesc: A light refreshment to bridge the gap between second breakfast and luncheon. The Shire approves of your dedication.
badges.instruction: Eat elevenses to claim this badge.

badges.name: "You Shall Not Pass"
badges.longDesc: Upon the Bridge of Khazad-d√ªm, Gandalf the Grey makes his stand against shadow and flame. "You. Shall. Not. Pass!"
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: Fellowship of the Ring
badges.longDesc: The journey begins. Witness the forming of the Fellowship and their departure from Rivendell.
badges.instruction: Finish watching The Fellowship of the Ring to claim this badge.

badges.name: Luncheon
badges.longDesc: A proper sit-down meal, as is right and proper. Even Samwise Gamgee would be proud of your commitment to hobbit tradition.
badges.instruction: Eat luncheon to claim this badge.

badges.name: "My Precious"
badges.longDesc: Witness the tortured soul of Sm√©agol as he wages war against himself. Two minds, one wretched creature. "We wants it. We needs it. Must have the precious."
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: Afternoon Tea
badges.longDesc: A civilized pause for tea and sustenance. You've earned it, precious. Yes, you have.
badges.instruction: Eat afternoon tea to claim this badge.

badges.name: "The Ents Go to War"
badges.longDesc: The shepherds of the forest have reached a decision. The Ents march on Isengard. "There is no curse in Elvish, Entish, or the tongues of Men for this treachery."
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: The Two Towers
badges.longDesc: The fellowship is broken, but the story continues. Endure the second chapter and witness the Battle of Helm's Deep.
badges.instruction: Finish watching The Two Towers to claim this badge.

badges.name: "The Beacons Are Lit"
badges.longDesc: Gondor calls for aid! Witness the flame pass from peak to peak across the realm of men. "The beacons are lit! Gondor calls for aid!"
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: Dinner
badges.longDesc: The main evening feast. Refuel for the final push to Mount Doom. The end is in sight, but there is still far to go.
badges.instruction: Eat dinner to claim this badge.

badges.name: "I Am No Man"
badges.longDesc: The Witch-king of Angmar meets his doom. "No man can kill me." "I am no man." The prophecy is fulfilled.
badges.instruction: Watch this scene to claim this badge.

badges.name: Supper
badges.longDesc: The seventh and final meal of a long day's journey. You have eaten as the hobbits eat. The Shire is proud of your appetite.
badges.instruction: Eat supper to claim this badge.

badges.name: Return of the King
badges.longDesc: The final chapter. Commit to seeing this through to the very end. All endings are also beginnings.
badges.instruction: Finish watching The Return of the King to claim this badge.

badges.name: There and Back Again
badges.longDesc: You have walked the full path from Bag End to Mount Doom and home again. Bilbo Baggins himself would tip his hat to your endurance.

badges.name: Second Breakfast Champion
badges.longDesc: Seven meals. All consumed. You have achieved the highest honor in hobbit society. Your dedication to culinary tradition is unmatched in all the Shire.

badges.name: Loremaster
badges.longDesc: A true scholar of Middle-earth. You witnessed every pivotal moment in the tale. The Red Book of Westmarch shall record your attentiveness.

badges.name: Ringbearer
badges.longDesc: You bore the weight of this quest to the very end. The fate of Middle-earth was in your hands, and you did not falter. Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.

splash.title: The Shire Passport
splash.subtitle: Official Documentation of One's Journey Through Middle-earth

name.prompt: What name shall be recorded in the official registry of travelers?

explainer.title: Your Quest Awaits
body: Before you lies a perilous journey through all three Extended Editions of The Lord of the Rings.
As you witness legendary moments and partake in the seven sacred meals of hobbit tradition, tap each badge to mark your progress.
explainer.quote: A wizard is never late, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.
explainer.disclaimer: All times are approximate-ish. This passport operates on the honor system. The Shire trusts its guests.

passport.certifySubtext: Complete your journey and download your certificate

certification.title: Return to the World of Men
body: Your journey through Middle-earth is complete (or as complete as you could manage).
By certifying this passport, you shall receive an official document commemorating your fellowship.
certification.footnote: You will be transported back to Austin, TX ‚Äî the realm of mortals.

completionMessages.perfect: Perfect completion! You are a true Ringbearer.
completionMessages.low: Every journey begins with a single step.

badgeModal.honorSystemText: The Shire Passport operates on the honor system. By claiming this badge, you solemnly swear you have witnessed this moment (or eaten this meal).

checklist.description: Made a mistake? Toggle badges on or off below. Secret badges unlock automatically when you complete their requirements.

certificate.subtitle: Official Documentation of One's Journey Through Middle-earth
certificate.footer: "The road goes ever on and on..."
